topic.title: Viewing Project Locations at the Enterprise Level

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Viewing Project Locations at the Enterprise Level

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: View and (where permitted) edit project locations across the enterprise; requires View or Edit permissions.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: Browse and manage project location records at enterprise scope, subject to role-based permissions.

ul.li:
The role of the logged-in user should be one of the following:
Administrative Support
Construction Inspector
Construction Manager
Engineer of Record
Director
Field Supervisor
Fund Manager
Manager
Program Manager
Project Manager
Support Services

body.context: The Enterprise Map Viewer enables you to view marked locations of various projects on a single map.

li.p: In the module menu, clickHome.
The ENTERPRISE DASHBOARD is displayed.
In the navigation pane, click Enterprise Map Viewer.
The ENTERPRISE MAP VIEWER page is displayed.
To search for or add specific projects to view marked locations, perform either of the following steps:
To search for specific projects using the search criteria, in the SEARCH CRITERIA section, perform the following steps:
In the Program(s) box, click and select the appropriate programs.
Alternatively, type the name of the program, and then select the appropriate program.
The list of all program records that have projects containing location data is displayed. For information managing programs, refer to Program.
In the Portfolio(s) box, click and select the appropriate portfolios.
Alternatively, type the name of the portfolio, and then select the appropriate portfolio.
The list of all the portfolio records in the enterprise is displayed. For information managing portfolios, refer to Portfolio Management.
To include inactive projects, select the Include Inactive Projects(s) check box.
Click Search.
The list of projects that match the defined search criteria is displayed in the SEARCH RESULTS section.
Optionally, click Reset to clear the search results in the SEARCH RESULTS section.
To add specific projects, in the SEARCH RESULTS section, perform the following steps:
Click Add.
The Project(s) dialog box is displayed.
The list of all the projects in the enterprise is displayed.
Select the appropriate projects, and then click Select.
The selected projects are added to the SEARCH RESULTS section.
To view the marked project locations on the map, in the SEARCH RESULTS section, select the appropriate projects, and then click Generate Map View.
The locations marked for the selected projects are displayed on the map.
From the Base Map drop-down list, select the required base map.
Available options are base maps defined in the BASE MAPS section in the GIS Settings page of the Administration module. For information on adding base maps, refer to Adding Base Maps.
From the Layer(s) section, select the required non-editable layer(s).

The selected layers are displayed in the Map View.
Available options are base maps defined in theLAYERS section in the GIS Settings page of the Administration module. For information on adding layers, refer toAdding Layers.
In the Forms section, to view the information on a specific form, clear the check box from the remaining forms.

p.note: By default, the list of forms that have enabled map control is selected. The project information marked on the forms are displayed in the map view.

li.p: To view project details of a location on a tooltip, click the geometry.
Tooltip details of the geometry that is configured for the form are displayed.

When multiple geometries are created at the same location, on clicking a geometry, you can view the details of all the geometries in that location by navigating using the left and right arrows in the tooltip.
To open the record applicable to the selected geometry, on the tooltip, click Navigate to Record.

p.note: You must have View or Edit permissions to view or edit a record.
